intro: Rosenbergiodendron formosum var. formosum, commonly known as the Formosan rosewood, is a species of flowering plant native to Taiwan. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its dense, dark-colored wood and aromatic leaves. The plant typically grows as a small to medium-sized evergreen tree, reaching heights of up to 15 meters. Its leaves are opposite, ovate, and have a glossy surface, while its flowers are small and white, clustered in inflorescences. Due to its unique appearance and valuable timber, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
